SesameOp: Novel backdoor uses OpenAI Assistants API for command and control

AI 5 min read

The article discusses a novel cybersecurity threat named "SesameOp," which employs the OpenAI Assistants API as a command-and-control (C2) mechanism for backdoor operations. This new approach allows cybercriminals to leverage the natural language processing capabilities of AI to obfuscate and execute malicious activities discreetly. By using the AI platform, attackers can efficiently manage compromised systems, bypass traditional security measures, and enhance their ability to launch and control attacks. AI 5 min read

The Electronic Privacy Information Center (EPIC) has issued a new whitepaper highlighting the privacy risks associated with government data mining programs. The report examines how these programs collect, analyze, and store vast amounts of personal data, often without adequate oversight or transparency. It emphasizes the potential for abuse and the erosion of privacy rights, urging for stricter regulations and better accountability measures to protect citizens' personal information. EPIC Recommends Privacy-Protective Age Assurance Standards in Comments to the California DOJ

Tech 5 min read

The Electronic Privacy Information Center (EPIC) has submitted recommendations to the California Department of Justice advocating for robust privacy protections in age assurance standards. Their comments emphasize the importance of minimizing data collection and employing privacy-preserving technologies to verify age without compromising users' personal information. EPIC stresses that any age verification system should adhere to principles such as data minimization, security, and transparency to protect individuals' privacy, particularly for children and adolescents.
